intro: Saussurea nyingchiensis, commonly known as the Nyingchi saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas, particularly in regions of China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stem and large, showy flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually pale blue or white, with ray florets that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
